channel.title: JDK problem
channel.description: Hey guys, i have installed the JDK lastest version from the official website and when i try to compile something for exemple all start scape source it says ERROR you do not have JDK 5.0 OR 6.0 .... i have the JDK 6u21.. any one can please help, also i can get my computer to recognize java :S

item.title: JDK problem
item.dc:creator: @str_pk3 str pk3
item.description:
@str_pk3 wrote:

did u do the environmental variables,
did u also do this my friend told me this way if i dled jdk newly:
so u go to every batch file u got and click the edit bottun and dont open the batch files together, do it saparetly now u see the jdk16.0_0.14 or something like that, if it was like that, change it to the file name in
c:/program files/java and there u find the jdk now just take the name and copy it and just replace it with the old once in all the batch files

this might be caused becuz who created the source had this old jdk and the newer the jdk is the better is the server

Read full topic

item.title: JDK problem
item.dc:creator: @igli igli
item.description:
@igli wrote:

try this code:

@echo off title Compiling... cd src javac -cp . -d ../bin/ ./*java pause

if that doesn’t work try this one:

@echo off @TITLE Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: JDK problem
item.dc:creator: @kryst-scape kryst-scape
item.description:
@kryst-scape wrote:

Right click compileand hit edit. Make sure it has a (x86) there, if not, then put it there.
